description: FIRST FLOOR SIDE TO REAR EXTENSION, REAR DORMER AND ALTERATIONS TO FRONT (REVISED)
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.
REASON: To comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.
Condition : 2 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the extension hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building.
REASON: To safeguard the appearance of the locality.
Condition : 3 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that order with or without modification), no window(s)/door(s), other than those shown on the approved plans shall be installed in the flank wall(s) of the development hereby permitted without the prior permission in writing of the local planning authority.
REASON: To safeguard the amenity of neighbouring residents.
Condition : 4 - The window(s) in the flank wall(s) of the proposed development shall:
(a) be of purpose-made obscure glass,
(b) be permanently fixed closed below a height of 1.8m above finished floor level,
and shall thereafter be retained in that form.
REASON: To safeguard the amenity of neighbouring residents.
Condition : 5 - The extension hereby permitted shall not be occupied at any time for any other purpose than as part of the original single family dwellinghouse and should not be used as a separate dwelling unit.
REASON: To safeguard the amenity of neighbouring residents and the character of the locality.
